page.title: 18A LOCAL CUSTOM
page.content: In Allendale there is a special custom which takes place at {New Year.}In this custom people carry {Tar Barrels which have a special name -{Barls.} About 90 years ago the Tar Barrels would be Tar Barrels but now they use fruit and jam barrels. These are filled with wood shavings and chopped sticks coated with paraffin. The Barls are lit at 11.35 p.m. at the Church and carried in a procession led by the band. The procession proceeds around the out skirts of the village and back to the{Bonfire}in the market place. When the men arrive at the fire it is nearly{Midnight}and so one by one the{Barls}are flung onto the fire causing a huge blaze. As the Church clock strikes {Midnight}everyone in the Market place joins hands to sing,{ {"Auld Lang Syne"}and everyone wishes each other a Happy New Year.
